forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock gently ticks past midnight, Downtown San Francisco finds itself in a tranquil embrace of subdued light and cool breezes. The overnight hours bring a whisper of rain, a mere hint before dawn, as the clouds drift lazily across the heavens, leaving behind a slightly dampened atmosphere. With temperatures hovering in the upper forties, the air feels crisp against the skin, stirred by a west-northwest wind that carries the coastal essence of the Bay Area. The likelihood of precipitation holds at 20%, offering a flicker of uncertainty, like the fleeting shadows of a passing fog.

As dawn breaks, the forecast presents a welcome contrast; the sun will emerge tomorrow, casting golden rays across a crisp blue canvas. Temperatures will peak around sixty, before gently retreating to the mid-fifties, a mild invitation to venture outdoors. Dressing in layers is wise—perhaps a light sweater and a windbreaker, perfect for the morning chill yet comfortable enough for the sun's embrace later in the day. The pleasantness of the sun-soaked afternoon beckons one to stroll along the waterfront or enjoy a quiet coffee at a local café, where the aroma of fresh pastries mingles with the fresh sea air. While the marine layer may cling to the edges of the Golden Gate at times, here in the heart of the city, clarity reigns, revealing the stunning urban landscape below, punctuated by the iconic silhouettes of its storied landmarks.
